stepTitle:
The enthalpy change for the hydrogenation of ethyne (C₂H₂) to ethene (C₂H₄) is:

C₂H₂ (g) + H₂ (g) → C₂H₄ (g) ΔH₁ $$=$$ $$-175.0$$ kJ (at 25°C)

The enthalpy change for the hydrogenation of ethene to ethane (C₂H₆) is:

C₂H₄ (g) + H₂ (g) → C₂H₆ (g) ΔH₂ $$=$$ $$-136.0$$ kJ (at 25°C)

Using these two reactions, calculate the enthalpy change at 25°C for the following overall reaction:

C₂H₂ (g) + 2H₂ (g) → C₂H₆ (g)
stepBody: Provide your answer in kJ to one decimal place.
